title: AMS Digital Agency marketing UI/UX revamp to SEO Sherpa-like style (React + Tailwind + shadcn/ui)

requirements.summary: Revamp marketing-site UI/UX to SEO Sherpa-like structure while preserving AMS branding/content across primary sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary pages/sections follow an SEO Sherpa-like structure (e.g., clear top navigation, prominent hero, service/value sections, proof/metrics/testimonials, process, CTA blocks, footer) while using AMS Digital Agency content/branding.
Consistent design system is applied (type scale, spacing scale, button/link styles, card styles, section padding) across all pages/sections.
All user-facing text is in English.
Responsive layouts are implemented for mobile, tablet, and desktop with no overflow/layout breakage on common breakpoints.
Navigation and CTAs are clearly styled and accessible (visible hover/focus states, keyboard navigable).

file_operations.description: Create/define global design tokens and baseline styles (font stack, type scale, spacing rhythm, section padding defaults, focus ring styling) to support an SEO Sherpa-like look while retaining AMS branding. Ensure English-only text defaults where applicable (e.g., placeholder copy).

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions to support the new design system (container widths, typography scale helpers, brand color tokens, shadows/radii) consistent with the SEO Sherpa-like aesthetic while keeping AMS brand colors. Use Tailwind utilities rather than custom component edits.

Wire a marketing-site layout that matches the requested section structure: top navigation + hero + services/value + proof/metrics + testimonials + process + CTA blocks + footer. Ensure the structure uses semantic sections and AMS content/branding. Use the shadcn-ui component set by composition (e.g., Button/Card/Accordion) without editing immutable UI source files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable header/navigation component with SEO Sherpa-like layout (logo left, primary nav, prominent primary CTA). Implement accessible navigation semantics and keyboard support; keep copy in English. Use shadcn-ui Button (and related primitives if needed) by composition; do not edit immutable UI files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a structured footer (service links, company/contact, legal, social, final CTA) consistent with the new design system and AMS branding. Ensure semantic markup and accessible link styling; English text only.

Create an SEO Sherpa-like hero section (strong headline, supporting paragraph, primary+secondary CTAs, trust/proof row). Use responsive layout and consistent spacing/typography; English text only. Compose shadcn-ui Buttons/Cards as needed without editing immutable UI files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a services/value section using reusable cards (icon/heading/description + link/CTA) matching the new spacing, typography, and hover states. Compose shadcn-ui Card and Button components; do not modify immutable UI files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a proof/metrics section (numbers, badges, short claims) with a clean grid and consistent visual hierarchy. Ensure responsive behavior and stable layout (no shifting).

Create a testimonials/social proof section (cards/quotes) with accessible typography and consistent card styling. Compose shadcn-ui Card (and optional carousel-like layout using simple CSS/scroll snapping if needed) without editing immutable UI files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a process section (step-by-step) in an SEO Sherpa-like style (numbered steps, concise descriptions). Optionally compose shadcn-ui Accordion for mobile-friendly disclosure while keeping content easily scannable; do not modify immutable UI files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable CTA block component (headline, supporting text, primary CTA) with high-contrast styling consistent with the design system and clear focus/hover states. Compose shadcn-ui Button without editing immutable UI files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a reusable section wrapper (consistent max width, padding, optional background variants) to enforce consistent section structure/spacing across the marketing UI.

requirements.summary: Implement SEO Sherpa-like UX details: sticky/clear header, strong hierarchy, reusable sections, and polished micro-interactions using React + Tailwind + shadcn/ui composition only.
acceptanceCriteria: Header/navigation behavior and styling feels comparable to SEO Sherpa (clean, prominent CTAs, consistent spacing, optional sticky behavior if appropriate).
Buttons, links, and cards have consistent hover/active/focus states and use subtle transitions (no jarring animations).
All new UI is built by composing existing UI components; no changes are required in immutable paths under frontend/src/components/ui or listed immutable hook/main files.

file_operations.description: Add sticky/clear header behavior (e.g., sticky on scroll, subtle background/blur, shadow, and height transitions) while preserving accessibility (skip link support, focus management, keyboard navigable menus). Ensure interaction patterns align with SEO Sherpa-like polish; keep animations subtle.
Add variants (e.g., default, muted, highlight) and consistent vertical rhythm utilities to standardize section spacing and visual hierarchy across the site.

Create a small, reusable set of motion/transition utility classnames (e.g., consistent durations/easings for hover/focus/active) to ensure micro-interactions are uniform and subtle across buttons/links/cards.
Create a tiny wrapper/utility component (or exported class helper) to standardize visible focus indicators across interactive elements without modifying immutable shadcn/ui sources.

Implement global hover/focus/active styling conventions (focus-visible rings, link underlines, button transitions, card hover elevation) using Tailwind layers/utilities so all composed components share consistent micro-interactions. Ensure no reliance on editing immutable UI component files.

Ensure all newly created marketing sections are composed via the reusable section components and consistent interaction utilities; confirm no immutable shadcn/ui source files are edited. Use shadcn-ui components by composition only. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Meet baseline accessibility, performance, and SEO-friendly markup for the revamped marketing site.
acceptanceCriteria: All images include appropriate alt text; headings follow a logical hierarchy (H1 once per page, then H2/H3).
Color contrast is readable for primary text on backgrounds; interactive elements have visible focus indicators.
Pages avoid unnecessary heavy assets/animations; layout remains stable (no major cumulative layout shifts during load).

file_operations.description: Improve SEO-friendly document metadata and structure (ensure lang is set, add descriptive title/metadata placeholders aligned to AMS branding, and ensure the root structure supports stable layout). Keep all user-facing text in English.

Ensure semantic, SEO-friendly markup in the marketing layout: a single H1 in the hero, subsequent sections use H2/H3 logically; use <main>/<header>/<nav>/<footer>; ensure CTAs are proper buttons/links. Confirm stable layout (avoid late-loading height changes) and avoid heavy animations.

Enforce heading hierarchy (single H1), add any hero imagery with explicit dimensions and meaningful alt text (or omit decorative images), and ensure CTAs have accessible names and visible focus states.
Ensure card/link semantics are accessible (proper headings, aria-labels where necessary), hover states don’t reduce contrast, and layouts don’t overflow at common breakpoints.

Validate/adjust contrast-sensitive tokens and focus-visible styling to meet readability; reduce motion where appropriate (respect prefers-reduced-motion) to support accessibility and prevent jarring animations.
